snippet: The Internet station, operating from a wee space on First Avenue since 2003 and beloved by music fans in New York City and around the world, is succumbing to rising costs.
abstract: East Village Radio, which offers a rich mix of music and voices almost impossible to find on commercial radio, will soon close after years of rising expenses; station embraced the nonconformity of Manhattan's East Village and quickly became a neighborhood institution with a devoted following; closing is being mourned in similar fashion to other East Village institutions that have shut down, as gentrification continues to advance.
lead_paragraph: The Internet station, operating from a wee space on First Avenue since 2003 and beloved by music fans in New York City and around the world, is succumbing to rising costs.

headline.main: Station That Mirrors East Village’s Spirit Is Signing Off
headline.print_headline: Station That Mirrors East Village’s Spirit Is Signing Off
